docs.snippet: The bullishness that set in in the stock market this week when General Eisenhower and President Truman met in Washington, apparently has not had any marked influence on seat prices on the New York Stock Exchange. Arrangements were made yesterday for...
docs.lead_paragraph: The bullishness that set in in the stock market this week when General Eisenhower and President Truman met in Washington, apparently has not had any marked influence on seat prices on the New York Stock Exchange. Arrangements were made yesterday for the transfer of a seat at $42,000, or $2,000 less than was paid in the last previous sale on Nov. 10, at $44,000.

docs.snippet: The Canadian dollar bounced back rather smartly last week from the irregularly lower trend which had marked its course the last month. In premium, the dollar climbed from 1 17/32 cent on Monday, to 2 1/4 cent, on Wednesday, with Friday's final of 2...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian dollar bounced back rather smartly last week from the irregularly lower trend which had marked its course the last month. In premium, the dollar climbed from 1 17/32 cent on Monday, to 2 1/4 cent, on Wednesday, with Friday's final of 2 1/16 cent, a gain of 7/16 cent over the preceding week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended Nov. 21, 1952.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 24-- A majority of United Nations members voted today to condemn the Soviet Union and its satellites for having refused to repatriate thousands of Greek children now in countries behind the Iron Curtain.
